Literature Review: The use of natural scenes in studying the cerebral cortex's role in visual search has gained significant attention in recent years due to its ability to approximate real-world visual environments. This approach has been employed in both human and monkey studies, providing valuable insights into the neural mechanisms underlying visual search. In this review, we will examine the results from behavioral and neurophysiological studies using natural scene viewing, highlighting new findings that enhance our understanding of the cerebral cortex's role in visual search.
